properties.areaDesc: Schuyler; Tompkins; Cortland; Tioga; Otsego; Broome; Chenango
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 20 at 12:17PM EST by NWS Binghamton NY
properties.description:
At 1217 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from near Plymouth to Cortland to Starkey. Movement was
south at 15 mph.

Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this dangerous squall.

This dangerous squall will be near...
Virgil around 1245 PM EST.
Reading Center around 1250 PM EST.
Norwich and Reynoldsville around 1255 PM EST.
Burdett around 100 PM EST.
Harford around 105 PM EST.
Watkins Glen and Marathon around 110 PM EST.
Montour Falls and Oxford around 115 PM EST.

Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in
this dangerous squall.

Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this dangerous
snow squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads
are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the
squall passes your location.

Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be
prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra
time when traveling.

NWSheadline: A DANGEROUS SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT WEST CENTRAL OTSEGO...CENTRAL SCHUYLER...NORTHWESTERN BROOME...SOUTHERN CORTLAND...NORTHEASTERN TIOGA...CENTRAL TOMPKINS AND CENTRAL CHENANGO COUNTIES
